channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Water shortages could derail UK’s net zero plans, study finds
item.description: Tensions grow after research in England finds there may not be enough water for planned carbon capture and hydrogen projects Revealed: Europe’s water ...

item.title: Japan ‘One Piece’ singer stopped mid-performance as Japan-China relations sour
item.description: Axing of Maki Otsuki performance in Shanghai the latest in a spate of cancelled cultural events involving Asia’s two biggest economies Japanese “One P...

item.title: Lessons not learned after Georgia Barter driven to suicide by abuse, says her mother
item.description: Family ‘saddened’ by minister’s response to London coroner’s concerns over police database access Georgia’s story: how a domestic abuse victim’s suici...

item.title: Can you have a community without craic? Scholars of Ireland’s pubs warn of declining numbers
item.description: Two new books analyse what makes the ‘perfect pub’ and both come to a sobering conclusion: Irish pubs are in trouble Like triple-distilled whiskey, Ir...

item.title: All the president’s millions: how the Trumps are turning the presidency into riches
item.description: From Vietnam to the Balkans, Donald Trump’s family has launched a global dealmaking blitz since his re-election A crusading prosecutor in the Balkans ...

item.title: Venezuela condemns Trump's threat to close country's airspace
item.description: US President Donald Trump says airspace over Venezuela should be considered closed "in its entirety" as tensions mount between the two countries.

item.title: Root questions need for pink-ball Ashes Test
item.description: Joe Root says he can understand why the Ashes features a pink-ball Test despite feeling like the England-Australia rivalry doesn't need one.

item.title: Four killed in shooting at child's birthday party in California
item.description: Police say 10 others are injured in what they believe is a "targeted" shooting, with children among the victims.

item.title: Ukraine hits tankers in Black Sea in escalation against Russia
item.description: The two ships struck by drones were thought to be used to bypass Western sanctions on Russia.

item.title: 'One of our greatest writers': King leads tributes to Sir Tom Stoppard
item.description: The King and Queen said they were "deeply saddened" by the loss of "a dear friend".
